metadata.Title: CVE-2012-0876 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The XML parser (xmlparse.c) in expat before 2.1.0 computes hash values without restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via an XML file with many identifiers with the same value.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2012-0876` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-1
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-1
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

libxmlrpc-c++8v5 - 1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6
libxmlrpc-core-c3 - 1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6
xmlrpc-api-utils - 1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6
No subscription required

xotcl - 1.6.5-1.2
xotcl-shells - 1.6.5-1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> RedHat issued https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2012-1250.html for python as a result of the added XML_SetHashSalt symbol ebarretto> tla uses system expat as of 1.3.5+dfsg-15 rodrigo-zaiden> the vulnerable code was added in expat version 1.95.7, with commit https://github.com/libexpat/libexpat/commit/8650b04b libxmltok seems to use code based on expat version 1.2 and does not add this commit, so, it's not affected.

criterions.comment: cadaver package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
expat package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-1').
matanza package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
swish-e package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
tla package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
xmlrpc-c package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6').
xotcl package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-1.2').
